job.title: Software Engineer (C#)
job.description: <p><strong>Must Haves: </strong></p><p>• At least a Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field (or equivalent experience) </p><p>• 6+ years of experience in software development </p><p>• Fundamental knowledge of Object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem-solving and complexity analysis. </p><p>• Proven skills in C# and JavaScript (preferably VueJS) and two or more of the following: </p><p> ➢ TypeScript, CSS, SQL </p><p>• The ability to communicate with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs. </p><p>• Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and in solving challenging problems. </p><p>• The ability to think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems. </p><p>• The ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing requirements.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Pluses: </strong></p><p>• Experience building complex multi-tier software systems and or services</p><p>• Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations </p><p>• SQL Server development skills including data integration, data modeling, query performance tuning, designing stored procedures </p><p>• Experience with Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in applications, especially smart card credentials</p><p>• Experience with ORM technologies like Entity Framework, Dapper, or NHibernate </p><p>• Experience with development in a Windows environment using .Net, Active Directory, IIS, Remote Desktop Services etc.</p><p>• Experience with web-based applications, both local and cloud </p><p>• Familiar with cloud solution stacks from either AWS or Azure </p><p>• Experience with windows services, microservices, docker, containers </p><p>• Experience writing, documenting and consuming REST APIs, GraphQL, etc </p><p>• Familiar with development using Secure Software Development Lifecycle standards</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Day to Day: </strong></p><p>You work in a fast-paced environment where you will develop and deliver software that&nbsp;simplifies solutions for a broad set of interrelated problems. Specifically, you will join a talented team of dedicated professionals in delivering production-quality code against well[1]drafted requirements and business logic from product management. You will have the opportunity to create and deploy cutting edge solutions for commercial and government clients&nbsp;alike. Best of all, you’ll get to grow your experience working alongside smart people to solve&nbsp;problems that make the world a safer, more efficient place.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>What does a typical day look like for the Software Developer?</p><p>Although no two days will be the same, you’ll:</p><p>• Participate in high functioning software development projects including design and test</p><p>• Interpret requirements and design specifications to develop, debug, test and maintain </p><p>software applications to be deployed against a broad array of platforms and cloud services.</p><p>• Maintain current knowledge of relevant technology</p><p>• Proactively manage relationships with other team members</p><p>• Present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of </p><p>audiences.</p><p>• Facilitate consensus building and resolution of complex technical issues</p><p>• Present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.</p><p>• Be an active participant in your development along your career path</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>
